column5: Watchmaker Movado Group Inc  reported a higher second-quarter profit and raised its full-year earnings forecast for the second time this year  encouraged by improved gross margins and continued demand for its namesake and licensed brands.

column4: BRIEF - Moody's revises The New York Times outlook to stable
column5: Aug 28 Moody's revises The New York Times outlook to stable from positive; upgrades liquidity rating to SGL-1 FROM SGL-2

column4: Nordic American sees weak 3rd-qtr amid tanker downturn
column5: Aug 28 Nordic American Tankers Ltd  expects third-quarter results to be weaker than in the preceding quarter as tanker rates remain depressed in an oversupplied market.

column4: SEC charges 8 men with insider trading around 2009 Sanofi deal
column5: Aug 28 U.S. securities regulators on Tuesday charged eight people with illegally trading on inside information in 2009 about French pharmaceutical company Sanofi's plan to buy a Tennessee-based company that made allergy medicine and other products.

column4: Sanofi's Genzyme recalls kidney transplant rejection drug
column5: Aug 28 The U.S. health regulator said Sanofi's  rare disease division  Genzyme  voluntarily recalled nine lots of its drug Thymoglobulin  which treats transplant rejection in kidney transplant patients.

column4: Statoil to drill 9 wells in Barents Sea in 2013
column5: OSLO  Aug 28 Norwegian oil and gas firm Statoil  is to drill nine exploration wells in the Arctic Barents Sea next year in a push to try to find oil even further north than previously  the firm said on Tuesday.

column5: HONG KONG  Aug 28 Private equity firm Blackstone Group and Taiwan's Wei family  the founders of instant noodle and MSG maker Ting Hsin International Group  are seeking to raise $282 million in five-year debt to back the purchase of a commercial property in Shanghai  Basis Point reported  citing unnamed sources.

column4: Brazil judges uphold Chevron  Transocean operating ban
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO An injunction banning No. 2 U.S. oil company Chevron Corp and its drilling contractor Transocean Ltd from operating in Brazil was upheld by a panel of three Brazilian federal judges on Tuesday while charges over a November oil spill are being considered.

column4: UPDATE 1-US poultry companies worry  prepare for Hurricane Isaac
column5: CHICAGO  Aug 28 U.S. poultry producers across the South are stockpiling fuel  testing generators and making other preparations in a bid to make sure their chicken houses and poultry processing plants can continue operations in the wake of Hurricane Isaac.

column4: TEXT-S&P may cut United Parcel Service
column5: Overview      -- United Parcel Service (UPS) recently announced that the regulatory  authorities in Europe are moving to a phase two review of its proposed  acquisition of TNT Express N.V.       -- UPS also announced that it has reached an agreement with the New  England Teamsters and Trucking Industry Pension Fund (NETTI) to restructure  the withdrawal liability related to that plan.       -- We are evaluating the company's exposure to multiemployer pension  plans as part of our review.       -

column4: TEXT-S&P rates Cheniere Energy Partners L.P.
column5: Overview      -- U.S. midstream energy master limited partnership Cheniere Energy  Partners L.P. (CQP) has cancelled its $750 million term loan B issuance and has also delayed plans to purchase the Creole Trail Pipeline from parent  Cheniere Energy Inc. (CEI).      -- CEI has repaid its convertible senior unsecured notes and is debt  free.       -- We are assigning a 'B+' corporate credit rating to CQP.      -- At the same time we are withdrawing our preliminary 'B+' rating on the  term loan B i
